summary: metagenomic Next-Generation Sequencing (mNGS) has increasingly been used for an assumption-free virological diagnosis. however, the systematic workflow evaluation on clinical respiratory samples and implementation of quality controls (QCs) is still lacking. the approach described herein is crucial to bring standardization and to ensure the quality of the generated sequences in clinical setting. electronic supplementary material The online version of this article contains supplementary material, which is available to authorized users. ezVIR viral database identified human adenovirus C-2 (accession number: KF268130.1), cytomegalovirus (accession number: GQ396662.1), human parainfluenza virus 3 (accession number: KF687321.1), human rhinovirus C (accession number: JF317014.1) and MS2 bacteriophage.
